accussed_details.name: Ghulam Rasul
allegation: Murder of Abdul Ghani and Khalid Mahmood

complaint_summary: Ghulam Rasul accused of murdering his two sons, Abdul Ghani (18 years) and Khalid Mahmood (12 years), due to suspicion of teasing his wife.
investigation_summary: Police recovered blood-stained earth, shoes, chadar, and kassi from the crime scene and appellant's house. Confessional statement recorded but deemed coerced.
judgment_summary: The court upheld the conviction under Section 302 of the Pakistan Penal Code for double murder. The plea of grave and sudden provocation was rejected. Death sentences and fines were confirmed.
punishment: Death sentence on two counts and fine of Rs. 4,000 per count. In default, further four years of rigorous imprisonment.
legal_arguments: Judicial confession deemed coerced and inadmissible.
Eye-witness accounts corroborated by medical evidence.
Grave and sudden provocation plea rejected due to lack of evidence.

witness_statement.Muhammad Yousuf: Observed Ghulam Rasul attacking his sons with kassi.

key_issues: Applicability of grave and sudden provocation

legal_terms.Judicial confession: A statement made by the accused before a magistrate admitting guilt.
legal_terms.Grave and sudden provocation: A defense claiming loss of self-control due to immediate provocation.

words_and_phrases.Kassi: A sharp-edged agricultural tool used in the murders.

summary_vector_notes: Ghulam Rasul was convicted for the double murder of his sons due to suspicion of teasing his wife. The court rejected his defense of grave and sudden provocation, citing inconsistencies and lack of evidence. Eye-witness accounts and medical evidence corroborated the prosecution's case. Judicial confession was deemed coerced and excluded. Death sentences and fines were confirmed.
